definitions.definition: (a person or thing) coming before all others in order, time, amount, quality, or importance:
examples: This is my first visit to New York.

definitions.definition: in or at the beginning (of a series of events):
examples: The trousers shrank when I washed them, but they weren't really big enough in the first place.

definitions.definition: as the first attempt or effort:
examples: Enquiries about the post should be addressed in the first instance to the personnel manager.

definitions.definition: at the earliest time in the day:
examples: He said he'd call back first thing tomorrow.

definitions.definition: before all others in order, time, amount, quality, or importance:
examples: Tom came first in the race.
When did you first meet each other?

definitions.definition: used at the beginning of a list of things you want to say or write:
examples: First, I want to thank my parents.

definitions.definition: the first person or thing to do or be something, or the first person or thing mentioned:
examples: [ + to infinitive ] She was one of the first to arrive.
I've opposed the proposal from the very first.
